Articles.Content: Do you play KSP on Linux, if so tell me, how do you find it, I started playing it on Linux today and it is a tiny bit laggy but that is probably my computer, so how do you find KSP for Linux?

I prefer Linux (Debian) over Windows any day, but until they come up with a Linux version of Unity I'll keep playing on my crappy Windows 8.1 laptop.

*edit*

Actually, what I'd like to see, is the ability to compile & link Unity and your KSP install plus mods into something native executable.

Edited November 15, 2014 by LordFerret
Works well enough for me though it wasn't always this way, the early Linux releases were pretty slow and buggy, KSP was actually faster in Wine.

Works well for me too, but I've an old ATI 4870 and I can't play with the legacy AMD drivers (always a blackscreen) ... I need to use the opensource drivers (mesa version 10.3.3).

On Linux, the GPU drivers aren't as good as on Windows, AMD drivers and Intel drivers are really bad.

It has been so long since I last used Windows, I don't remember any real difference. Main difference is that x64 is stable on my machine (i5, 8GB ram, GTX 650Ti running Kubuntu). Gotta have all the mods!
